title: Invariant decomposition
summary: The invariant decomposition is a decomposition of the elements of Pin ( p , q , r ) {\displaystyle {\text{Pin}}(p,q,r)} groups into orthogonal commuting elements. It is also valid in their subgroups, e.g. orthogonal, pseudo-Euclidean, conformal, and classical groups.
